author: Adrienne Cutway
title: Airline announces plan to weigh passengers before boarding
text:
By Adrienne Cutway contact the reporter Airline announces plan to weigh passengers before boarding 
Uzbekistan Airways has announced a plan to weigh passengers before they board the plane in what it calls a safety precaution, according to Yahoo Travel . 0 
After checking in, travelers will be asked to step on a “special weighing machine” with their carry-on luggage. The airline says the numbers will remain confidential and will only be categorized as man, woman or child -- names will not be recorded and passengers will not be charged more or less based on their weight. 
"According to the rules of International Air Transport Association, airlines are obliged to carry out the regular procedures of preflight control passengers weighing with hand baggage to observe requirements for ensuring flight safety," the airline said in a statement, according to USA Today . 
The IATA told CNN its unaware of such a rule. 
The press release announcing the new policy is no longer available on Uzbekistan Airways' website, it's unclear why. 
Though some people have been taken aback by the policy, it's not a new concept for air travel. Samoa Air has a system of charging passengers per kilo based on how much they weigh with their bags. 
It also has a “Samoa XL” row with seats that are two inches wider and reserved for passengers who are heavier than 130 kilos, or 286 pounds. 
Click here to read more on this story at Yahoo.com.
